intro: Trigonella dura, commonly known as the hard trigonella, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces pods that contain several elliptical seeds, which are often used in traditional medicine. Trigonella dura is adapted to arid environments, showing resilience to drought conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and agricultural studies.
